<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Syncretism](/Feats.aspx?ID=1186) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=26" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 105 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Remove the final sentence of Syncretism that specifies the feat’s benefit if your cleric doctrine is not cloistered cleric or warpriest._

**Prerequisites**
you follow a deity

</column>

---

You have come to see the overlap between two deities’ teachings. Choose a second deity. You must meet their alignment requirements, and you are subject to their edicts and anathema. If you are a cloistered cleric, select one of that deity’s domains, gaining the benefits of the [Expanded Domain Initiate](/Feats.aspx?ID=1172) feat with that domain. If you are a warpriest, you gain the favored weapon of that deity as a second favored weapon, and it gains the benefits of feats and abilities you have that affect your deity’s favored weapon, such as [Deadly Simplicity](/Feats.aspx?ID=264). If you have a different doctrine than cloistered cleric or warpriest, either apply whichever of the above options is most appropriate for your doctrine, or, at the GM’s discretion, add a benefit from the second deity more closely tied to your doctrine.
name: Syncretism
